```{python}
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Read in the dataset
url = "http://byuistats.github.io/CSE250-Course/data/clean_starwars.csv"
sw_dat = pd.read_csv(url)

# Identify the location columns
location_columns = [col for col in sw_dat.columns if col.startswith('location_(census_region)_')]

# Create a dictionary to map location names to numeric values
location_mapping = {location: idx for idx, location in enumerate(location_columns)}

# Create a new column to store the numeric values
sw_dat['location_numeric'] = sw_dat[location_columns].idxmax(axis=1).map(location_mapping)

# Display a histogram of the numeric values
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
sns.histplot(sw_dat['location_numeric'], bins=len(location_columns), kde=False)
plt.xlabel('Location Numeric Value')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')
plt.title('Histogram of Location Numeric Values')
plt.show()

```
